details.description: Contact the Identity and Passport Service (IPS) advice line - telephone, text relay, textphone, opening hours
details.body:
Contact the Identity and Passport Service (IPS) for advice about passports.

Passport Adviceline:

www.ips.gov.uk
Telephone: 0300 222 0000
Text Relay: 18001 0300 222 0000
Textphone: 0300 222 0222
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
Weekends and public holidays, 9am to 5:30pm

You can also send fill in an online enquiry form.

Identity and Passport Service
Globe House
89 Eccleston Square
London
SW1V 1PN

Find more information about getting a passport:

  • renew or replace an adult UK passport
  • apply for your first adult passport
  • get a passport for a child
  • passport fees
  • passport Check & Send service
  • getting a passport urgently

details.description: Eligibility, fees, applying, renewing and updating

parent.title: Citizenship and life in the UK

details.description: Includes voting and how government works
Includes driving abroad, getting a passport, pet passports and bringing goods into the UK

Book your driving test or get a tax disc online, find out the legal requirements for buying, owning, importing or scrapping a car or motorcycle, and read about your rights and responsibilities as a driver.
How much it costs to renew or get a new adult or child passport and ways you can pay
How to use the Post Office passport Check & Send service for passport applications and renewals, what it costs, where you can use the service
Renew or amend a passport urgently with the Premium one-day service or the Fast Track one-week service
If you're disabled, there are free services and facilities to help you with your passport application
